poem:
### The Forgotten Cells

Voices echo in the hollow halls,  
where justice's heavy hand lays bare  
the cost of neglect, unseen, unheard.  
Concrete walls cradle despair,  
souls adrift in a sea of apathy.  
Unmoved, society turns away,  
blind to the seeds we sow  
in the shadows of our indifference.
